preamble: In this section you will decrobe the experimental design and sample, such as experimental condition and trial number per condition, number of participants, participant exclusion and presenting software.  NOTE: If you notice a bug, or have a suggestion, we'd be grateful if you posted an issue on GitHub: https://github.com/INCF/artem-is/
question: How many participants took part in the study?
How many participants, in total, were included in the analysis, after exclusion of participants?
Specify reasons for excluding participants.
Is the design of this study full factorial?
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: new question to incorporate Katarina's comments that the study design is not clear. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: How many between-subject factors does this study/pipeline have?
details: If you do not have any, please put zero in this field.
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: new question to incorporate Katarina's comments that the study design is not clear. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: List between-subject factors with factor levels in the brackets, separated by semicolon
details: For example: smoking (yes, no); handedness (left, right)
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: new question to incorporate Katarina's comments that the study design is not clear. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: How many experimental/comparison groups did the study feature in total?
details: If participants were not divided into separate groups, please enter 1 to indicate 1 condition. If the design is not full factorial, this number might differ from the total number of between-subject factor level combinations
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: minor rephrasing. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: List of all groups used in the study separated by semicolon and a space in the same order in which you want to describe groups in later questions concerning individual groups
details: Example: smokers left-handed; smokers right-handed; non-smokers left-handed; non-smokers right-handed
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: minor rephrasing. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: How many participants did each group have after exclusion?
details: Input numeric values in the same order in which groups were listed in the previous question. Values should be separated by semicolon and a space.
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: How many within-subject factors does this study/pipeline have?
details: If you do not have any, please put zero in this field.
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: new question to incorporate Katarina's comments that the study design is not clear. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: List within-subject factors with factor levels in the brackets, separated by semicolon
details: For example: semantic match (match, mismatch); arousal (high, low)
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: new question to incorporate Katarina's comments that the study design is not clear. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: How many within-subject conditions did the study have in total?
details: If your within-subjects data is not divided into separate conditions, please enter 1 to indicate 1 condition. If the design is not full factorial, this number might differ from the total number of between-subject factor level combinations.
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: minor rephrasing. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: List of all within-subject conditions used in the study in the same order in which you want to describe them in later questions concerning individual within-subject conditions.
details: Values should be separated by a semicolon and a space. For example: low arousal match; low arousal mismatch; high arousal match; high arousal mismatch
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: minor rephrasing.. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: Did you analyse relationship between ERPs and a non-ERP continuous variable (e.g., correlation of an ERP measure with IQ)
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: new question to incorporate Katarina's comments that the study design is not clear.. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: Continuous variables analysed together with ERPs
Change_log: 25.08.2023 Angela: new question to incorporate Katarina's comments that the study design is not clear. Also, this whole sub-section is renamed to "Variables"

question: What determined the number of trials each participant was presented with?
choices: fixed N of trials delivered | adaptive N of trials (e.g., presenting trials with behavioural errors again until correct response) | Other
Change_log: 7.9.2023 Angela: replaced "subject" with participant to keep terminology consistent

question: How many trials in total was each participant presented with (including repetition of the same stimuli or trials)?
Change_log: 7.9.2023 Angela: replaced "subject" with participant to keep terminology consistent

question: How many trials did each condition feature (including repetition of the same stimuli or trials)?
details: Values should be separated by semicolon and a space and given in the same order as the conditions were listed earlier. If there are multiple groups of participants, list trial counts for all within-subject conditions for one group, and then for the next one - following the ordering of groups and within-subkect conditions as you specified them earlier.

question: Explain how it was determined how many trials a participant was presented with.
How many trials on average was a participant presented with, in total (including repetition of the same stimuli or trials)?
What was the minimum number of trials a participant was presented with, in total  (including repetition of the same stimuli or trials)?
What was the maximum number of trials a participant was presented with, in total  (including repetition of the same stimuli or trials)?
How many trials on average was a participant presented with, per condition  (including repetition of the same stimuli or trials)?
details: Values should be separated by semicolon and a space and given in the same order as the conditions were listed earlier. If there are multiple groups of participants, list trial counts for all within-subject conditions for one group, and then for the next one - following the ordering of groups and within-subkect conditions as you specified them earlier.

question: What was the minimum number of trials a participant was presented with, per condition (including repetition of the same stimuli or trials)?
details: Values should be separated by semicolon and a space and given in the same order as the conditions were listed earlier. If there are multiple groups of participants, list trial counts for all within-subject conditions for one group, and then for the next one - following the ordering of groups and within-subkect conditions as you specified them earlier.

question: What was the maximum number of trials a participant was presented with, per condition  (including repetition of the same stimuli or trials)?
details: Values should be separated by semicolon and a space and given in the same order as the conditions were listed earlier. If there are multiple groups of participants, list trial counts for all within-subject conditions for one group, and then for the next one - following the ordering of groups and within-subkect conditions as you specified them earlier.

question: After eliminating trials on all bases (e.g., artifacts, behavioural errors), how many trials, on average, did you include for each condition per participant?
details: Insert numbers for each condition, separated by a semicolon and a space, in the same order as the conditions were listed earlier. If there are multiple groups of participants, list trial counts for all within-subject conditions for one group, and then for the next one - following the ordering of groups and within-subkect conditions as you specified them earlier.
Change_log: 7.9.2023 Angela: replaced "subject" with participant to keep terminology consistent

question: Specify the minimum number of trials analyzed per condition for any participant.
details: Values should be separated by semicolon and a space and given in the same order as the conditions were listed earlier.  If there are multiple groups of participants, list trial counts for all within-subject conditions for one group, and then for the next one - following the ordering of groups and within-subkect conditions as you specified them earlier.
Change_log: 7.9.2023 Angela: replaced "subject" with participant to keep terminology consistent

question: Which presenting software did you use to show your experimental task?
Specify software version if applicable, programming language if "custom script" was selected, and software name and version if "other" was selected.
